title: Home â€“ AWS ML Specialty Ebook
summary: Overview of the AWS ML Specialty ebook, how to use it for exam preparation, and high-level mapping of services to exam domains.

title: Table of Contents
summary: Structured table of contents grouping all covered AWS services by machine learning pipeline role, with deep links to each service page.

title: About & License
summary: Explains the purpose of the ebook, sources and citation approach, license information, and how to update and extend the content.

title: Cheat Sheet
summary: Concise exam-day cheat sheet with quick comparisons between AWS ML-related services across ingestion, storage, analytics, modeling, and operations.

title: Practice Questions
summary: Collection of practice questions and explanations across data engineering, exploratory analysis, modeling, and ML operations for the AWS ML Specialty exam.

title: Glossary
summary: Glossary of common AWS and machine learning terms, including data lake, feature, inference, drift, feature store, and serverless inference definitions.

title: Search
summary: Client-side search interface that lets you query the ebook content using tokens and see highlighted matches with short snippets.

title: Amazon Kinesis Data Streams
summary: Scalable, durable streaming service for low-latency ingestion with custom consumers, replay, and shard-based scaling used for ML feature pipelines.

title: Amazon Kinesis Data Firehose
summary: Fully managed service for delivering streaming data into S3, Redshift, and OpenSearch with buffering, compression, and optional transforms.

title: Amazon Managed Service for Apache Flink
summary: Managed Apache Flink service for stateful stream processing, real-time feature engineering, and complex event processing on Kinesis or Kafka streams.

title: Amazon S3
summary: Durable, scalable object storage and the core data lake layer for ML training data, features, artifacts, and batch inference outputs.

title: AWS Glue
summary: Serverless data integration service with a managed Data Catalog, crawlers, and Spark-based ETL jobs for building curated ML datasets.

title: AWS Lake Formation
summary: Service for building and securing governed data lakes with fine-grained table and column permissions over S3 data via the Glue Data Catalog.

title: Amazon EMR
summary: Managed big data platform for running Spark, Hadoop, and other engines on EC2 or serverless for large-scale feature engineering and ML preprocessing.

title: Amazon Athena
summary: Serverless SQL query service for analyzing data in S3 using the Glue Data Catalog, ideal for ad-hoc exploration and lightweight feature creation.

title: Amazon Redshift
summary: Managed cloud data warehouse with columnar storage, Spectrum for S3, and Redshift ML for in-database model training integrated with SageMaker.

title: Amazon OpenSearch Service
summary: Managed OpenSearch clusters for search, log analytics, and vector search used in ML monitoring and retrieval-augmented generation solutions.

title: Amazon Mechanical Turk
summary: Crowdsourcing marketplace for human intelligence tasks used to obtain labels and human judgments for machine learning datasets.

title: Amazon SageMaker
summary: End-to-end managed ML platform with Studio, training jobs, endpoints, Pipelines, Feature Store, and Model Monitor for production ML workflows.

title: Amazon Bedrock
summary: Managed generative AI service providing access to multiple foundation models with guardrails, knowledge bases, and agents for building genAI apps.

title: Amazon Q
summary: Family of generative AI assistants such as Q Developer and Q Business that help developers and business users work with AWS and enterprise data.

title: Amazon Comprehend
summary: NLP service for sentiment analysis, key phrases, entities, and custom classification or entity recognition on text data.

title: Amazon Rekognition
summary: Computer vision APIs for detecting objects, scenes, faces, text in images, unsafe content, and custom labels in images and videos.

title: Amazon Transcribe
summary: Automatic speech recognition (ASR) service for converting speech to text via batch and streaming transcription with custom vocabularies.

title: Amazon Polly
summary: Text-to-speech service with standard and neural voices for generating natural-sounding audio from text and SSML inputs.

title: Amazon Translate
summary: Neural machine translation service for real-time and batch translation with custom terminology and domain adaptation features.

title: Amazon Textract
summary: Document analysis service that extracts text, forms, tables, and key-value pairs from scanned documents and PDFs.

title: Amazon EC2
summary: Virtual machine service providing CPU and GPU instances where you can run custom ML training, inference, and tooling with full control.

title: AWS Batch
summary: Managed batch processing service that runs containerized workloads on EC2 or Fargate, ideal for queued training and batch inference jobs.

title: Amazon ECR
summary: Managed container registry for storing Docker images used by ECS, EKS, Batch, and SageMaker custom training or inference containers.

title: Amazon ECS
summary: AWS-native container orchestration service for running Docker containers on EC2 or Fargate, suitable for ML microservices and pipelines.

title: Amazon EKS
summary: Managed Kubernetes service enabling Kubernetes-based ML platforms and workloads with GPU nodes and integration to AWS networking and IAM.

title: AWS Fargate
summary: Serverless compute engine for containers that runs ECS tasks or EKS pods without managing EC2 instances or clusters.

title: AWS IoT Greengrass
summary: Edge runtime and cloud service for building and managing applications on IoT devices, including local ML inference and preprocessing.

title: Amazon CloudWatch
summary: Monitoring and observability service providing metrics, logs, alarms, and dashboards for ML infrastructure and application health.

title: AWS CloudTrail
summary: Service that records AWS API calls and account activity, used to audit who accessed or changed ML-related resources and data.

title: Amazon EBS
summary: Block storage for EC2 instances supporting high-performance volumes and snapshots used for ML training data and artifacts.

title: Amazon EFS
summary: Managed elastic NFS file system providing shared POSIX storage for multiple ML compute nodes such as EC2, ECS tasks, or EKS pods.

title: Amazon FSx
summary: Family of managed file systems; FSx for Lustre is especially used for high-performance shared storage in large ML training clusters.

title: Amazon VPC
summary: Virtual private cloud networking service defining subnets, routing, and endpoints for isolating and securing ML environments.

title: AWS IAM
summary: Identity and access management service controlling which users and roles can access ML services, data, and infrastructure.

title: Amazon QuickSight
summary: Cloud-native BI service with dashboards, embedded analytics, and ML-powered insights for visualizing ML outputs and business metrics.
